sn4.25:1.1: Then Māra the Evil One, having spoken these verses of disappointment in the presence of the Blessed One, went away from that spot and sat down cross-legged on the ground not far from the Blessed One, silent, dismayed, with his shoulders drooping, downcast, brooding, unable to speak, scratching the ground with a stick.
sn4.25:1.2: Then Māra’s daughters—Taṇhā, Aratī, and Ragā—approached Māra the Evil One and addressed him in verse:
sn4.25:2.2: Who’s the man for whom you grieve?
sn4.25:2.3: We’ll catch him with the snare of lust
sn4.25:2.4: As they catch the forest elephant.
sn4.25:2.5: We’ll bind him tightly and bring him back,
sn4.25:2.6: And he’ll be under your control. ”
sn4.25:3.1: “The Arahant, the Fortunate One in the world,
sn4.25:3.2: Is not easily drawn by means of lust.
sn4.25:3.3: He has gone beyond Māra’s realm:
sn4.25:4.1: Then Māra’s daughters—Taṇhā, Aratī, and Ragā—approached the Blessed One and said to him:
sn4.25:4.3: But the Blessed One paid no attention, as he was liberated in the unsurpassed extinction of acquisitions.
sn4.25:5.1: Then Māra’s daughters—Taṇhā, Aratī, and Ragā—went off to the side and took counsel:
sn4.25:5.3: Suppose we each manifest ourselves in the form of a hundred maidens. ”
sn4.25:5.4: Then Māra’s three daughters, each manifesting herself in the form of a hundred maidens, approached the Blessed One and said to him:
sn4.25:5.6: But the Blessed One paid no attention, as he was liberated in the unsurpassed extinction of acquisitions.
sn4.25:6.1: Then Māra’s daughters went off to the side and again took counsel:
sn4.25:6.3: Suppose we each manifest ourselves in the form of a hundred women who have never given birth. ”
sn4.25:6.4: Then Māra’s three daughters, each manifesting herself in the form of a hundred women who have never given birth …
sn4.25:6.6: But the Blessed One paid no attention, as he was liberated in the unsurpassed extinction of acquisitions.
sn4.25:7.2: in the form of a hundred women who have given birth once …
sn4.25:8.2: in the form of a hundred women who have given birth twice …
sn4.25:8.7: in the form of a hundred women of middle age …
sn4.25:9.2: in the form of a hundred old women, approached the Blessed One and said to him:
sn4.25:9.5: as he was liberated in the unsurpassed extinction of acquisitions.
sn4.25:9.6: Then Māra’s daughters—Taṇhā, Aratī, and Ragā—went off to the side and said:
sn4.25:9.7: “What our father told us is true:
sn4.25:10.1: “‘The Arahant, the Fortunate One in the world …
sn4.25:11.1: ’“If we had assailed with such tactics any ascetic or brahmin who was not devoid of lust, either his heart would have burst, or he would have vomited hot blood from his mouth, or he would have gone mad or become mentally deranged;
sn4.25:11.2: Just as a green reed that has been mowed down would dry up and wither away and become shrivelled.
sn4.25:11.3: In the same way, he would have dried up and withered away and become shrivelled.”
sn4.25:12.1: Then Māra’s daughters—Taṇhā, Aratī, and Ragā—approached the Blessed One and stood to one side.
sn4.25:12.2: Standing to one side, Māra’s daughter Taṇhā addressed the Blessed One in verse:
sn4.25:13.1: “Is it because you are sunk in sorrow that you meditate in the woods?
sn4.25:13.2: Because you’ve lost wealth or pine for it,
sn4.25:13.3: Or committed some crime in the village?
sn4.25:13.4: Why don’t you make friends with people?
sn4.25:13.5: Why don’t you form any intimate ties?”
sn4.25:14.1: The attainment of the goal, the peace of the heart.
sn4.25:14.2: “Having conquered the army of the pleasant and agreeable,
sn4.25:14.4: Therefore I don’t make friends with people,
sn4.25:14.5: Nor will I form any intimate ties. ”
sn4.25:15.1: Then Māra’s daughter Aratī addressed the Blessed One in verse:
sn4.25:16.1: “How does a bhikkhu here often dwell
sn4.25:16.2: That, five floods crossed, he here has crossed the sixth?
sn4.25:16.3: How does he meditate so sensual perceptions
sn4.25:16.4: Are kept at bay and fail to grip him?”
sn4.25:17.1: “Tranquil in body, in mind well liberated,
sn4.25:17.4: He does not erupt, or drift, or stiffen.
sn4.25:18.1: “When a bhikkhu here often dwells thus,
sn4.25:18.2: With five floods crossed, he here has crossed the sixth.
sn4.25:18.3: When he meditates thus, sensual perceptions
sn4.25:18.4: Are kept at bay and fail to grip him. ”
sn4.25:19.1: Then Māra’s daughter Ragā addressed the Blessed One in verse:
sn4.25:20.1: “He has cut off craving, faring with his group and order;
sn4.25:20.2: Surely many other beings will cross and lead them away .
sn4.25:20.3: Alas, this homeless one will snatch many people beyond the King of Death. ”
sn4.25:21.1: Truly, lead by the the great heroes,
sn4.25:21.3: are leading by means of the Dhamma,
sn4.25:21.4: What envy can there be in those who understand?”
sn4.25:22.1: Then Māra’s daughters—Taṇhā, Aratī, and Ragā—approached Māra the Evil One.
sn4.25:22.2: Māra saw them coming in the distance
sn4.25:23.1: “Fools! With the stalks of lotus flowers,
sn4.25:23.2: You tried to batter a mountain
sn4.25:23.3: To dig up a mountain with your nails,
sn4.25:23.4: To chew iron with your teeth.
sn4.25:24.1: “As if, having lifted a rock with your head,
sn4.25:24.2: You sought a foothold in the abyss;
sn4.25:24.3: As if you struck a stump with your breast,
sn4.25:25.1: They had come to him glittering with beauty—
sn4.25:25.3: But the Teacher swept them away right there
sn4.25:25.4: As the wind, a fallen cotton tuft.
